meanings.definition: Located or situated in the southeast direction.
meanings.sent1: The house had a southeasterly view of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: The southeasterly corner of the garden gets the most sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The southeasterly room was always warm and cozy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile pointed in a southeasterly direction, brightening up the room.
meanings.sent5: The southeasterly location of the restaurant made it a popular spot for sunset views.

meanings.definition: Moving or directed towards the southeast.
meanings.sent1: The ship sailed in a southeasterly direction.
meanings.sent2: The hikers followed a southeasterly path through the forest.
meanings.sent3: The southeasterly breeze gently pushed the leaves around.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts drifted in a southeasterly manner, focusing on the future.
meanings.sent5: The southeasterly flow of traffic indicated rush hour was approaching.

meanings.definition: A wind blowing from the southeast.
meanings.sent1: The sailors adjusted the sails to catch the southeasterly wind.
meanings.sent2: The weather forecast predicted a southeasterly breeze in the afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The picnic turned chaotic when the southeasterly wind blew away the napkins.
meanings.sent4: The southeasterly wind carried the scent of blooming flowers across the field.
meanings.sent5: Children flew their kites, hoping the southeasterly wind would lift them high.
